00048 /*                                                                      */
00049 /*      Title:          GTA high level channel access routines C        */
00050 /*                      function prototypes                             */
00051 /*      File:           cadef.h                                         */
00052 /*      Environment:    Architecture independent                        */
00053 /*                      ( Current ports )                               */
00054 /*                      VAXC, VMS V4.6                                  */
00055 /*                      SUNC, BSD UNIX V4.3                             */
00056 /*                      SUNC, vxWorks                                   */
00057 /*                                                                      */
00058 /*                                                                      */
00059 /*      Purpose                                                         */
00060 /*      -------                                                         */
00061 /*                                                                      */
00062 /*      GTACS universal remote access library function prototypes.      */
00063 /*      ( C default argument passing mechanisms )                       */
00064 /*                                                                      */
00065 /*      Special comments                                                */
00066 /*      ------- --------                                                */
00067 /*      "ca_" is the standard prefix for the "channel access" library   */
00068 /*      function names.                                                 */
00069 /*                                                                      */
00070 /*                                                                      */
00071 /************************************************************************/
00072 /*_end                                                                  */

00109 /*
00110  *
00111  *      NOTE: the channel in use fields type, count, name, and
00112  *      host name are available to applications. However it is 
00113  *      recommended that the following MACROS be used to access them.
00114  *
00115  */
00116 #define ca_field_type(CHID)             ((CHID)->type)
00117 #define ca_element_count(CHID)          ((CHID)->count)
00118 #define ca_name(CHID)                   ((char *)((CHID)+1))
00119 #define ca_puser(CHID)                  ((CHID)->puser)
00120 #define ca_host_name(CHID)              ca_host_name_function(CHID)
00121 #define ca_read_access(CHID)            ((CHID)->ar.read_access)
00122 #define ca_write_access(CHID)           ((CHID)->ar.write_access)
00123 /*
00124  *      cs_ - `channel state'   
00125  *      
00126  *      cs_never_conn           valid chid, IOC not found
00127  *      cs_prev_conn            valid chid, IOC was found, but unavailable
00128  *      cs_conn                 valid chid, IOC was found, still available
00129  *      cs_closed               invalid chid
00130  */
00131    enum channel_state { cs_never_conn, cs_prev_conn, cs_conn, cs_closed };
00132 #define ca_state(CHID)                  ((CHID)->state)
00133 
00134    typedef struct ca_access_rights {
00135       unsigned read_access:1;
00136       unsigned write_access:1;
00137    } caar;
00138 
00139 
00140 /* Format for the arguments to user connection handlers                 */
00141    struct channel_in_use;
00142    struct connection_handler_args {
00143       struct channel_in_use *chid;      /* Channel id                   */
00144       long op;                  /* External codes for CA op     */
00145    };
00146 
00147 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00148    typedef void caCh(struct connection_handler_args args);
00149 #else                           /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00150    typedef void caCh();
00151 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00152 
00153 /* Format for the arguments to user access rights handlers              */
00154    struct access_rights_handler_args {
00155       struct channel_in_use *chid;      /* Channel id                   */
00156       caar ar;                  /* New access rights state      */
00157    };
00158 
00159 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00160    typedef void caArh(struct access_rights_handler_args args);
00161 #else                           /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00162    typedef void caArh();
00163 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00164 
00165    struct channel_in_use {
00166       ELLNODE node;             /* list ptrs                    */
00167       short type;               /* database field type          */
00168 #define TYPENOTCONN     (-1)    /* the type when disconnected   */
00169       unsigned short count;     /* array element count          */
00170       union {
00171          unsigned sid;          /* server id                    */
00172          struct db_addr *paddr; /* database address             */
00173       } id;
00174       void *puser;              /* user available area          */
00175       enum channel_state state; /* connected/ disconnected etc  */
00176       caar ar;                  /* access rights                */
00177 
00178       /*
00179        *      The following fields may change or even vanish in the future
00180        */
00181       caCh *pConnFunc;
00182       caArh *pAccessRightsFunc;
00183       ELLLIST eventq;
00184       unsigned cid;             /* client id */
00185       unsigned retry;           /* search retry number */
00186       void *piiu;               /* private ioc in use block */
00187 #ifdef vxWorks
00188       void *ppn;                /* ptr to optional put notify blk */
00189 #endif                          /* vxWorks */
00190       /*
00191        * channel name stored directly after this structure in a 
00192        * null terminated string.
00193        */
00194    };
00195 
00196    typedef struct channel_in_use *chid;
00197    typedef long chtype;
00198    typedef struct pending_event *evid;
00199    typedef double ca_real;
00200 
00201 /*      The conversion routine to call for each type    */
00202 #define VALID_TYPE(TYPE)  (((unsigned short)TYPE)<=LAST_BUFFER_TYPE)
00203 
00204 
00205 /* argument passed to event handlers and callback handlers              */
00206    struct event_handler_args {
00207       void *usr;                /* User argument supplied when event added      */
00208       struct channel_in_use *chid;      /* Channel id                                   */
00209       long type;                /* the type of the value returned               */
00210       long count;               /* the element count of the item returned       */
00211       void *dbr;                /* Pointer to the value returned                */
00212       int status;               /* CA Status of the op from server - CA V4.1    */
00213    };
00214 
00215    struct pending_event {
00216       ELLNODE node;             /* list ptrs */
00217 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00218       void (*usr_func) (struct event_handler_args args);
00219 #else                           /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00220       void (*usr_func) ();
00221 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00222       void *usr_arg;
00223       struct channel_in_use *chan;
00224       chtype type;              /* requested type for local CA  */
00225       unsigned long count;      /* requested count for local CA */
00226       /* 
00227        * the following provide for reissuing a 
00228        * disconnected monitor 
00229        */
00230       ca_real p_delta;
00231       ca_real n_delta;
00232       ca_real timeout;
00233       unsigned id;
00234       unsigned short mask;
00235    };

00237    void epicsShareAPI ca_test_event(
00238 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00239                                       struct event_handler_args
00240 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00241        );
00242 
00243 /* Format for the arguments to user exception handlers                  */
00244    struct exception_handler_args {
00245       void *usr;                /* User argument supplied when event added      */
00246       struct channel_in_use *chid;      /* Channel id                                   */
00247       long type;                /* Requested type for the operation             */
00248       long count;               /* Requested count for the operation            */
00249       void *addr;               /* User's address to write results of CA_OP_GET */
00250       long stat;                /* Channel access std status code               */
00251       long op;                  /* External codes for channel access operations */
00252       char *ctx;                /* A character string containing context info   */
00253       char *pFile;              /* source file name (may be NULL) */
00254       unsigned lineNo;          /* source file line number */
00255    };

00260 /*
00261  *
00262  *      External OP codes for CA operations
00263  *
00264  */
00265 #define CA_OP_GET               0
00266 #define CA_OP_PUT               1
00267 #define CA_OP_SEARCH            2
00268 #define CA_OP_ADD_EVENT         3
00269 #define CA_OP_CLEAR_EVENT       4
00270 #define CA_OP_OTHER             5
00271 #define CA_OP_CONN_UP           6
00272 #define CA_OP_CONN_DOWN         7

00304  */

00306 ca_search_and_connect(NAME, CHIDPTR, 0, 0)
00307 /*      ca_search
00308         (
00309                 Name    IO      Value                                   
00310                 ----    --      -----                                   
00311 char *,         NAME    R       NULL term ASCII channel name string     
00312 chid *          CHIDPTR RW      channel index written here              
00313         );
00314 */
00315

00319  ************************************************************************/
00320 #define ca_build_channel(NAME,XXXXX,CHIDPTR,YYYYY)\
00321 ca_build_and_connect(NAME, XXXXX, 1, CHIDPTR, YYYYY, 0, 0)
00322 
00323 #define ca_array_build(NAME,XXXXX, ZZZZZZ, CHIDPTR,YYYYY)\
00324 ca_build_and_connect(NAME, XXXXX, ZZZZZZ, CHIDPTR, YYYYY, 0, 0)

00327 /*
00328  * preferred search mechanism
00329  */
00330    int epicsShareAPI ca_search_and_connect(
00331 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00332                                              /*      Name    IO      Value                                   */
00333                                              /*      ----    --      -----                                   */
00334                                              char *,    /*       NAME    R       NULL term ASCII channel name string     */
00335                                              chid *,    /*       CHIDPTR RW      channel index written here              */
00336                                              void (*)(struct connection_handler_args),
00337                                              /*      PFUNC   R       the address of user's connection handler */
00338                                              void *     /*      PUSER   R       placed in the channel's puser field     */
00339 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */

00402 /************************************************************************/
00403 /*      Write a value to a channel                                      */
00404 /************************************************************************/
00405 #define ca_bput(CHID,PVALUE)    ca_array_put(DBR_STRING, 1, CHID, (PVALUE))
00406 /*
00407 C Type          Name    IO      Value                                   
00408 ------          -----   --      -----                                   
00409 chid            CHID    R       channel id                              
00410 char *          PVALUE  R       pointer to a binary value string
00411 */
00412 
00413 #define ca_rput(CHID,PVALUE)\
00414 ca_array_put(DBR_FLOAT, 1, CHID, (PVALUE))
00415 /*
00416 C Type          Name    IO      Value                                   
00417 ------          -----   --      -----                                   
00418 chid            CHID    R       channel id                              
00419 dbr_float_t *   PVALUE  R       pointer to a real value
00420 */
00421 
00422 #define ca_put(CHTYPE, CHID, PVALUE) ca_array_put(CHTYPE, 1, CHID, PVALUE)
00423 /*
00424                 Name    IO      Value                                   
00425                 ----    --      -----                                   
00426 chtype,         TYPE    R       channel type                            
00427 chid,           CHID    R       channel index                           
00428 void *          PVALUE  R       pointer to new channel value of type specified  
00429                                 i.e. status = ca_put(DBF_INT,chid,&value)       
00430 */
00431 
00432    int epicsShareAPI ca_array_put(
00433 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00434                                     /*      Name    IO      Value                                   */
00435                                     /*      ----    --      -----                                   */
00436                                     chtype,     /*      TYPE    R       channel type                            */
00437                                     unsigned long,
00438                                     /*      COUNT   R       array element count                     */
00439                                     chid,       /*      CHID    R       channel index                           */
00440                                     void *      /*      PVALUE  R       pointer to new channel value of type    */
00441                                     /*                      specified.                              */
00442 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00443        );
00444 
00445 /*
00446  * This routine functions identically to the original ca put request 
00447  * with the addition of a callback to the user supplied function 
00448  * after recod processing completes in the IOC. The arguments
00449  * to the user supplied callback function are declared in
00450  * the structure event_handler_args and include the pointer
00451  * sized user argument supplied when ca_array_get_callback() is called.
00452  */
00453    int epicsShareAPI ca_array_put_callback(
00454 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00455                                              /*      Name    IO      Value                                   */
00456                                              /*      ----    --      -----                                   */
00457                                              chtype,    /*      TYPE    R       channel type                            */
00458                                              unsigned long,
00459                                              /*      COUNT   R       array element count                     */
00460                                              chid,      /*      CHID    R       channel index                           */
00461                                              void *,    /*      PVALUE  R       pointer to new channel value of type    */
00462                                              void (*)(struct event_handler_args),
00463                                              /*      USRFUNC R       the address of a user supplied function */
00464                                              void *     /*      USRARG  R       An argument copied to the above function */
00465 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00466        );

00526 */

00566 /************************************************************************/
00567 /*      Specify a function to be executed whenever significant changes  */
00568 /*      occur to a channel.                                             */
00569 /*      NOTES:                                                          */
00570 /*      1)      Evid may be omited by passing a NULL pointer            */
00571 /*                                                                      */
00572 /*      2)      AN array count of zero specifies the native db count    */
00573 /*                                                                      */
00574 /************************************************************************/
00575    typedef struct event_handler_args evargs;
00576 
00577 /*      Assumes DELTA info comes from the database or defaults          */
00578 #define ca_add_event(TYPE,CHID,ENTRY,ARG,EVID)\
00579 ca_add_array_event(TYPE,1,CHID,ENTRY,ARG,0.0,0.0,0.0,EVID)
00580 
00581 /*              Name    IO      Value                                   
00582                 ----    --      -----                                   
00583 chid,           CHID    R       channel index                           
00584 void
00585 (*)(),          USRFUNC R       the address of a user supplied function 
00586 void *,         USRARG  R       An argument copied to the above function        
00587 evid *          EVIDPTR W       An id to refer to this event by 
00588 */
00589 
00590 
00591 
00592 /*      Sets both P_DELTA and M_DELTA below to argument DELTA           */
00593 #define ca_add_delta_event(TYPE,CHID,ENTRY,ARG,DELTA,EVID)\
00594         ca_add_array_event(TYPE,1,CHID,ENTRY,ARG,DELTA,DELTA,0.0,EVID)
00595 /*              Name    IO      Value                                   
00596                 ----    --      -----                                   
00597 chid,           CHID    R       channel index                           
00598 void
00599 (*)(),          USRFUNC R       the address of a user supplied function 
00600 void *,         USRARG  R       An argument copied to the above function        
00601 ca_real,        DELTA   R       Generate events after +-delta excursions        
00602 evid *          EVIDPTR W       An id to refer to this event by 
00603 */
00604 
00605 
00606 #define ca_add_general_event(TYPE,CHID,ENTRY,ARG,P_DELTA,N_DELTA,TO,EVID)\
00607 ca_add_array_event(TYPE,1,CHID,ENTRY,ARG,P_DELTA,N_DELTA,TO,EVID)
00608 
00609 #define ca_add_array_event(TYPE,COUNT,CHID,ENTRY,ARG,P_DELTA,N_DELTA,TO,EVID)\
00610 ca_add_masked_array_event(TYPE,COUNT,CHID,ENTRY,ARG,P_DELTA,N_DELTA,TO,EVID, DBE_VALUE | DBE_ALARM)
00611 
00612 
00613 
00614    int epicsShareAPI ca_add_masked_array_event(
00615 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00616                                                  /*      Name    IO      Value                                   */
00617                                                  /*      ----    --      -----                                   */
00618                                                  chtype,        /*      TYPE    R       requested external channel type         */
00619                                                  unsigned long,
00620                                                  /*      COUNT   R       array element count                     */
00621                                                  chid,  /*      CHID    R       channel index                           */
00622                                                  void (*)(struct event_handler_args),
00623                                                  /*      USRFUNC R       the address of a user supplied function */
00624                                                  void *,        /*      USRARG  R       An argument copied to the above function */
00625                                                  ca_real,       /*      P_DELTA R       Generate events after +delta excursions */
00626                                                  ca_real,       /*      N_DELTA R       Generate events after -delta excursions */
00627                                                  ca_real,       /*      TIMEOUT R       Generate events after timeout sec       */

00630 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */

00635 /************************************************************************/
00636 /*      Remove a function from a list of those specified to run         */
00637 /*      whenever significant changes occur to a channel                 */
00638 /*                                                                      */
00639 /************************************************************************/
00640    int epicsShareAPI ca_clear_event(
00641 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00642                                       /*      Name    IO      Value                                   */
00643                                       /*      ----    --      -----                                   */
00644                                       evid      /*      EVID    R       Event id returned by add event          */
00645 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00646        );
00647 
00648 
00649 /************************************************************************/
00650 /*                                                                      */
00651 /*       Requested data is not necessarily stable prior to              */
00652 /*       return from called subroutine.  Call ca_pend_io()              */
00653 /*       to guarantee that requested data is stable.  Call the routine  */
00654 /*       ca_flush_io() to force all outstanding subroutine calls to be  */
00655 /*       sent out over the network.  Significant increases in           */
00656 /*       performance have been measured when batching several remote    */
00657 /*       subroutine calls together into one message.  Additional        */
00658 /*       improvements can be obtained by performing local processing    */
00659 /*       in parallel with outstanding remote processing.                */
00660 /*                                                                      */
00661 /*       FLOW OF TYPICAL APPLICATION                                    */
00662 /*                                                                      */
00663 /*       search()               ! Obtain Channel ids                    */
00664 /*       .                      ! "                                     */
00665 /*                                                                      */
00666 /*       get()                  ! several requests for remote info      */
00667 /*       get()                  ! "                                     */
00668 /*       add_event()            ! "                                     */
00669 /*       get()                  ! "                                     */
00670 /*       .                                                              */
00671 /*       .                                                              */
00672 /*       .                                                              */
00673 /*       flush_io()             ! send get requests                     */
00674 /*                              ! optional parallel processing          */
00675 /*       .                      ! "                                     */
00676 /*       .                      ! "                                     */
00677 /*       pend_io()              ! wait for replies from get requests    */
00678 /*       .                      ! access to requested data              */
00679 /*       .                      ! "                                     */
00680 /*       pend_event()           ! wait for requested events             */
00681 /*                                                                      */
00682 /************************************************************************/
00683 
00684 /************************************************************************/
00685 /*      This routine pends waiting for channel events and calls the     */
00686 /*      functions specified with add_event when events occur. If the    */
00687 /*      timeout is specified as 0 an infinite timeout is assumed.       */
00688 /*      if the argument early is specified TRUE then CA_NORMAL is       */
00689 /*      returned when outstanding queries complete. Otherwise if the    */
00690 /*      argument early is FALSE the routine does not return until the   */
00691 /*      entire delay specified by the timeout argument has expired.     */
00692 /*      ca_flush_io() is called by this routine. If the argument        */
00693 /*      early is TRUE then ca_pend() will return immediately without    */
00694 /*      processing outstanding CA labor if no queries are outstanding   */
00695 /************************************************************************/
00696 #define ca_poll() ca_pend((1e-12), 0/*FALSE*/)
00697 #define ca_pend_event(TIMEOUT) ca_pend((TIMEOUT), 0/*FALSE*/)
00698 #define ca_pend_io(TIMEOUT) ca_pend((TIMEOUT), 1/*TRUE*/)
00699 
00700    int epicsShareAPI ca_pend(
00701 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00702                                /*      Name    IO      Value                                   */
00703                                /*      ----    --      -----                                   */
00704                                ca_real, /*      TIMEOUT R       timeout in seconds                      */
00705                                int      /*  EARLY   R       return early if IO completes            */
00706 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00707        );
00708

00710  * returns TRUE when queries are outstanding
00711  */
00712    int epicsShareAPI ca_test_io(
00713 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO

00715                                   /*      ----    --      -----                                   */
00716                                   void
00717 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00718        );
00719

00721 /*      Send out all outstanding messages in the send queue             */
00722 /************************************************************************/
00723    int epicsShareAPI ca_flush_io(
00724 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00725                                    void
00726 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00727        );

00751 /*
00752  *      Provided for efficient test and display of channel access errors
00753  */
00754 #define         SEVCHK(CA_ERROR_CODE, MESSAGE_STRING) \
00755 { \
00756         int ca_unique_status_name  = (CA_ERROR_CODE); \
00757         if(!(ca_unique_status_name & CA_M_SUCCESS)) \
00758                 ca_signal_with_file_and_lineno( \
00759                         ca_unique_status_name, \
00760                         (MESSAGE_STRING), \
00761                         __FILE__, \
00762                         __LINE__); \
00763 }

00773 /*
00774  *      CA_ADD_FD_REGISTRATION
00775  *
00776  *      call their function with their argument whenever 
00777  *      a new fd is added or removed
00778  *      (for use with a manager of the select system call under UNIX)
00779  *
00780  *      if (opened) then fd was created
00781  *      if (!opened) then fd was deleted
00782  *
00783  */
00784 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00785    typedef void CAFDHANDLER(void *parg, int fd, int opened);
00786 #else                           /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00787    typedef void CAFDHANDLER();
00788 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00789 
00790    int epicsShareAPI ca_add_fd_registration(
00791 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00792                                               CAFDHANDLER * pHandler, void *pArg
00793 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00794        );

00820 /*
00821  * CA synch groups
00822  *
00823  * This facility will allow the programmer to create
00824  * any number of synchronization groups. The programmer might then
00825  * interleave IO requests within any of the groups. Once The
00826  * IO operations are initiated then the programmer is free to
00827  * block for IO completion within any one of the groups as needed.
00828  */
00829    typedef unsigned WRITEABLE_CA_SYNC_GID;
00830 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00831    typedef const unsigned CA_SYNC_GID;
00832 #else
00833    typedef unsigned CA_SYNC_GID;
00834 #endif
00835 
00836 /*
00837  * create a sync group
00838  */
00839    int epicsShareAPI ca_sg_create(
00840 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00841                                     CA_SYNC_GID * pgid
00842 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00843        );
00844 
00845 /*
00846  * delete a sync group
00847  */
00848    int epicsShareAPI ca_sg_delete(
00849 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00850                                     CA_SYNC_GID gid
00851 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00852        );
00853 
00854 /*
00855  * block for IO performed within a sync group to complete 
00856  */
00857    int epicsShareAPI ca_sg_block(
00858 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00859                                    CA_SYNC_GID gid, ca_real timeout
00860 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00861        );
00862 
00863 /*
00864  * test for sync group IO operations in progress
00865  */
00866    int epicsShareAPI ca_sg_test(
00867 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO
00868                                   CA_SYNC_GID gid
00869 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00870        );
00871

00873  * ca_sg_reset
00874  */

00876 #ifdef CAC_FUNC_PROTO

00878 #endif                          /*CAC_FUNC_PROTO */
00879        );
